definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
the three gods in charge of heaven, earth and water (Daoism)

pinyin: Ya4 li4 shan1 da4 Da4 di4

definition: Cyrus the Great (ca. 600-530 BC), the founder of the Persian Empire and the conqueror of Babylon
Charlemagne (c. 747-c. 814), King of the Franks, Holy Roman Emperor from 800

sentences.english: His name was Charlemagne-Charles Magnus, the Great-emperor of the Romans.
sentences.chinese: 他就是神聖羅馬帝國皇帝查理曼大帝。

sentences.english: In that year, the Council of Nicaea was convened by emperor Constantine.
sentences.chinese: 在那些年裏，康斯坦丁大帝組建了尼西亞理事會。

sentences.english: At the left is a temple dedicated to the Roman emperor Hadrian.
sentences.chinese: 左邊是一座紀念古羅馬哈德里安大帝的廟宇。

sentences.english: The Jade Emperor asked the Earth God to inform all the animals about this news.
sentences.chinese: 玉皇大帝就通知土地公去公佈一個消息。

sentences.english: In 1716 he gave it to Peter the Great.
On the left there is your Attila the Hun.
sentences.chinese: 在你左邊的是匈奴大帝阿提拉。

sentences.english: Hot Rod and Galvatron fight deep within Unicron.
sentences.chinese: 熱破與驚破天於宇宙大帝體內對決。

sentences.english: Catherine the Great thought she governed in an enlightened manner.
sentences.chinese: 葉卡捷琳娜大帝認爲她在實行開明統治。

sentences.english: One legend features the Jade Emperor, also known as the Emperor of Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 有一個傳說的主角是玉皇大帝，又稱元始天尊。

sentences.english: At that moment, the Jade Emperor flew past on a turbulent cloud, waving his arms.
sentences.chinese: 在那時，玉皇大帝揮舞著雙手，乘著一片亂雲飛過。

sentences.english: In this case, Unicron has his very own Mini-Con: Dead End.
sentences.chinese: 因此他成爲了宇宙大帝自己的迷你金剛。

sentences.english: After the Persians it was Alexander the Great's turn.
sentences.chinese: 繼波斯帝國之後，阿富汗的統治者是亞歷山大大帝。

sentences.english: The project of this cascade was thought over thoroughly by the emperor.
sentences.chinese: 這個小瀑布工程據說完全由大帝本人想出。

sentences.english: St. Petersburg was founded by Peter the Great in 1703.
sentences.chinese: 聖彼得堡是彼得大帝於1703年建成的。

sentences.english: Alexander the Great was extremely fond of his warhorse Bucephalus.
sentences.chinese: 亞歷山大大帝非常寵愛他的戰馬比塞弗勒斯。

sentences.english: Peter the Great wanted his capital to be the most beautiful in Europe.
sentences.chinese: 彼得大帝想要讓他的首都成爲歐洲最美麗的城市。

definition: the most honorable/the most respected/supreme/(archaic) the emperor
the Second (of numbered kings)/second generation (e.g. Chinese Americans)
Hill (name)/Christopher Hill, US undersecretary of state of East Asian affairs
